Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: ENAMELLED; ENGRAVED; PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL
Name: Scarab
Description: Small, beautifully coloured but succinct scarab. All anatomical details are simply depicted. The flat surface bears a motif very typical of the Second Intermediate Period: a falcon, facing right, framed by two neb baskets ("lord, all, every").
